IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO OPERATE NON-COMMERCIAL RELIGIOUS AND EDUCATIONAL RADIO STATIONS
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO OPERATE NON-COMMERCIAL RELIGIOUS AND EDUCATIONAL RADIO STATIONS
IRS990.Description: EMF OPERATES NETWORKS (KLOVE AND AIR1) OF RADIO STATIONS AND TRANSLATORS WITH A NON-COMMERCIAL RELIGIOUS AND EDUCATIONAL FORMAT PROVIDING MUSIC, NEWS AND RELIGIOUS ANNOUNCEMENTS. EMF ALSO PROVIDES PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENTS FOR OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: POSTED INFORMATION ON OUR ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITES REGARDING PROPOSED LEGISLATION THAT WOULD AFFECT OUR ORGANIZATION AND REQUESTED THAT INDIVIDUALS CONTACT THEIR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS; MEMBERSHIP IN THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF BROADCASTERS AND THE NATIONAL RELIGIOUS BROADCASTERS

Form990ScheduleGPartIV.Explanation: BLUE NORTH STRATEGIES, INC. WAS PAID $250,801 FOR THE PERFORMANCE OF DIRECT MAIL SERVICES ON BEHALF OF EMF PURSUANT TO A CONTRACT AND STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW). THE SOW OUTLINED THE TASKS TO BE PERFORMED ON BEHALF OF EMF. SOME OF THESE TASKS INVOLVED CONSULTING WORK AND WERE DELINEATED IN THE SOW AS "PROFESSIONAL SERVICES." OTHER TASKS INVOLVED PRINTING, MAILING AND PROCESSING COSTS. THE STATEMENT OF WORK DELINEATED THESE ITEMS AS "ESTIMATED PROCESSING FEES." BLUE NORTH'S MONTHLY INVOICE WAS BASED ON THIS SEPARATION OF ACTIVITIES AND BROKE OUT THEIR CHARGES INTO TWO CORRESPONDING CATEGORIES. THOSE CATEGORIES WERE THEN RELIED UPON TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT TO BE ENTERED IN FORM 990, SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2(B)(V). SHAREMEDIA SERVICES, INC. WAS PAID $216,802 FOR THE PERFORMANCE OF CONSULTING WORK IN CONNECTION WITH EMF FUNDRAISING EFFORTS. THEIR ROLE CENTERS AROUND ON-AIR COACHING DURING PLEDGE DRIVES. SHAREMEDIA WAS COMPENSATED FOR THEIR PROFESSIONAL SERVICES AND TRAVEL RELATED EXPENSES WERE REIMBURSED. THE AMOUNT DISCLOSED IN FORM 990, SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2(B)(V) REPRESENTS SHAREMEDIA'S TOTAL BILLINGS REDUCED BY THE TRAVEL EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENT. EMF DID NOT HAVE ANY ARRANGEMENTS WITH FUNDRAISERS UNDER WHICH IT MADE PAYMENTS EXCLUSIVELY FOR FUNDRAISING ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES BUT NOT FOR PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISING SERVICES. EMF DOES NOT ENGAGE IN GAMING ACTIVITY. GROSS RECEIPTS FROM FUNDRAISING ACTIVITY WERE ESTIMATED USING DATA ACCUMULATED DURING OUR SEMI-ANNUAL PLEDGE DRIVES AND SUBSEQUENT FUNDRAISING EFFORTS, DURING WHICH THE ORGANIZATIONS LISTED PROVIDED "PROFESSIONAL SERVICES".

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: FOR MEDICAL REASONS, MIKE NOVAK WAS PROVIDED FIRST CLASS TRAVEL WHICH WAS NOT TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.
JON TAYLOR RECEIVED SEPARATION BENEFITS OF $137,861. RICK ROHLFING RECEIVED A SEVERANCE PAYMENT OF $90,877.
THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDED A DISCRETIONARY BONUS TO MIKE NOVAK, PRESIDENT & CEO.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED A DONATED RECREATIONAL VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE HAD PREVIOUSLY BEEN USED BY A BUSINESS WHICH HAD DEDUCTED ALL EXPENSES AS BUSINESS EXPENSES. THEREFORE, THERE WAS NO CLAIMED VALUE AND NO REQUIREMENT TO FILE FORM 1098-C.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS COMPLETED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM. THEREAFTER, THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED INTERNALLY BY MEMBERS OF THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT, SENIOR MANAGEMENT, AND INTERNAL AND OUTSIDE LEGAL COUNSEL. ONCE THEIR QUESTIONS ARE RESOLVED, THE DOCUMENT IS DISTRIBUTED TO EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW. WHEN THEIR REVIEW IS COMPLETE, THE FORM 990 IS FILED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE AWARE OF THE POLICY ON CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. IF ANY BOARD MEMBER IS EVER IN A POSITION OF A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE FULL BOARD WILL BE MADE AWARE OF THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT AND THE BOARD, LESS THE CONFLICTED MEMBER, WILL DETERMINE THE APPROPRIATE RESOLUTION. ADDITIONALLY, ALL EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT. IN THE EVENT AN EMPLOYEE DOES HAVE A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT IS RAISED TO THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER, AND ANY APPROPRIATE MEASURES ARE TAKEN. IN THE CASE OF AN EMPLOYEE WITH A FINANCIAL INTEREST IN A VENDOR THAT DOES BUSINESS WITH THE MINISTRY, COMPETITIVE BIDS ARE OBTAINED TO VERIFY THAT THE MINISTRY IS OBTAINING THE OPTIMAL VALUE FOR GOODS OR SERVICES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION OF OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES, INCLUDING THE CEO IS UNDER THE DIRECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COMPARABILITY STUDIES OF MARKET COMPENSATION LEVELS FOR EACH POSITION ARE CONDUCTED FOR THESE EMPLOYEES AS WELL. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DELIBERATES IN EXECUTIVE SESSION (WITHOUT THE CEO BEING PRESENT) TO APPROVE THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO, WITH THE OTHER SALARIES DELIBERATED ON DURING THE FORMAL BUDGET REVIEW PROCESS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST; ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST; AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON GUIDESTAR'S WEBSITE, EVANGELICAL COUNCIL FOR FINANCIAL ACCOUNTABILITY (ECFA) WEBSITE, AND UPON REQUEST.
